page.title: 13Ditchling Museum
page.content: Ditchling Museum was opened to the public in May l985.It is housed in the old church school overlooking the pond and green.The names of the Museum rooms are those of families who have been or are today,benefactors of Ditchling.A unique exhibit is the Wyvern a heraldic dragon made at the pottery on Ditchling Common, it was the emblem of Alfred the Great, one time owner of the manor of Dyccanlyngum.Rural life is portrayed on the ground floor _ the labourer's living room,his tools and games.Records and documents for research are upstairs.Apart from many interesting exhibits the Museum has a children's playground, refreshment room, souvenir shop and toilet facilities.
